  * **buld**:
    - Support python path that includes spaces. This should be of particular interest to our Windows users who may have python living in `c:/Program Files` (Felix Becker) [#4841](https://github.com/nodejs/node/pull/4841)
  * **https**:

comments.body:
This is really odd in here. If you look at how this displays at https://nodejs.org/en/blog/ it seems like it is related to the Version 5.7.1 release.

Shouldn't this go in a "Weekly Update"?

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +5,9 @@### Notable changes

* **governance**: The Core Technical Committee (CTC) added four new members to help guide Node.js core development: Evan Lucas, Rich Trott, Ali Ijaz Sheikh and Сковорода Никита Андреевич (Nikita Skovoroda).
* **openssl**: Upgrade from 1.0.2f to 1.0.2g (Ben Noordhuis) [#5507](https://github.com/nodejs/node/pull/5507).
  - Fix a double-free defect in parsing malformed DSA keys that may potentially be used for DoS or memory corruption attacks. It is likely to be very difficult to use this defect for a practical attack and is therefore considered low severity for Node.js users. More info is available at [CVE-2016-0705](https://www.openssl.org/news/vulnerabilities.html#2016-0705).

comments.body: Also add a link to the 13 changelog in the list above the table?

This change will break the version detection automation in 
https://github.com/nodejs/node/blob/de6cbd0e374e3d9209ddf56d1041b83b41efcbe6/tools/doc/versions.js#L64

Maybe it'll be reworked away in https://github.com/nodejs/node/issues/32077 but for the moment either put the dashes back in (making them consistent, if you like) or adjust the regular expression in the tooling.

The test for this, by the way, is in `doctool` ([`test/doctool/test-doctool-versions.js`](https://github.com/nodejs/node/blob/master/test/doctool/test-doctool-versions.js)) but you'll probably need to run it with `NODE_TEST_NO_INTERNET` (https://github.com/nodejs/node/pull/31849) set so that it uses the local copy of `CHANGELOG.md` instead of pulling down the latest from `master`.
Oh, this is good! This simplifies the regular expression.
